explanation:
You must inspect every function reachable from detect_cpu_core_count because MISRA's for-loop rule requires examination of the behaviour of functions called from within any for loop body. Although detect_cpu_core_count contains no for loop itself, its callees (and their callees) might. For each symbol: 

- mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count: direct callee. Inspect its implementation for any for loops and whether they satisfy the three-clause and single-loop-counter constraints. It itself calls several helpers. 

- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count: direct callee (also called by mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count). Inspect for for loops and whether those loops call or modify objects that would violate MISRA constraints. 

- mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_special_api_, mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysctl_, mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_: transitive callees of mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count. Each must be checked for for loops (their clauses, loop counters, side effects, and any functions they call). 

- mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysctl_fallback_, mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_: additional transitive callees (fallback paths) that may contain loops; include to cover all control-flow paths. 

- mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_, mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_, mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_np_, mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_w32_: transitive callees of mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count. Check each for for loops and for any side effects or modifications of objects used as loop counters. 

- MHD_REAL_CPU_COUNT: compile-time macro used as a fallback value. Include its definition to know its type and value (constant vs expression) because a macro expansion could introduce expressions or side effects that matter if used in loop clauses in any of the examined functions.

Notes: standard I/O functions (fprintf, printf) need not be examined for this check because they are library calls invoked outside any for loop in the target; only functions that are (or may be) invoked within for-loop bodies along the call tree need to be analyzed. Also, callers of detect_cpu_core_count are not required for checking for-loops inside detect_cpu_core_count and its callees.
